etymologies: mid 17th century: from Latin, ‘nursling, pupil’, from alere ‘nourish’

notes.text: When used in the singular, alumnus (which is a male form in Latin) sometimes refers specifically to a male former student, with alumna being the corresponding female term, but the plural alumni generally refers to both sexes (the plural form alumnae may be used when referring to two or more female former students). In the US, the shortened form alum is increasingly used in informal contexts to avoid gender-specific terminology altogether

definitions: a graduate or former student of a particular school, college, or university

examples.text: a mixture of news about the University and articles by alumni

shortDefinitions: former student of school or university

definitions: a former member of a group, company, or organization
shortDefinitions: former member of a group or organization
